a1: Meta tags are HTML elements placed in the head section of a webpage that provide metadata about the page to search engines and social media platforms.
q2: Which meta tags are most important for SEO?
a2: The most important meta tags are the title tag, meta description, robots tag, and canonical URL. Open Graph and Twitter Card tags are essential for social media sharing.
q3: What is the ideal meta description length?
a3: The ideal meta description length is between 130-160 characters. Search engines may truncate longer descriptions in search results.
q4: Do I need Open Graph tags?
a4: Yes, Open Graph tags control how your page appears when shared on Facebook, LinkedIn, and other platforms. Without them, platforms may display incorrect or incomplete information.
